thread.title: Panda ‘fakes pregnancy’ to get better living conditions
thread.title_full: Panda ‘fakes pregnancy’ to get better living conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Panda ‘fakes pregnancy’ to get better living conditions
text: More Chinese news and features at telegraph.co.uk/chinawatch Yuan Yuan, one of a pair given to Taiwan as gifts by the Chinese mainland in December 2008, had shown signs of pregnancy such as loss of appetite, thickening of the uterus and increased fecal progesterone concentration since 11 June. But panda experts flown in from the mainland determined through ultrasound checks that Yuan Yuan was not pregnant, according to Taiwan's Central News Agency. Pandas thought to be pregnant are moved into single rooms with air conditioning and round-the-clock care and also receive more fruits and bamboo The 11-year-old had been artificially inseminated on 26 and 27 March when she was on heat, according to a zoo spokesman. The symptoms of pregnancy are already beginning to return to normal appetite levels and behaviour, the spokesman said. Pandas thought to be pregnant are moved into single rooms with air conditioning and round-the-clock care and also receive more fruits and bamboo. Experts believe clever pandas display pregnancy behaviours to improve their quality of life after noticing the difference in treatment they receive. Yuan Yuan, which went to Taiwan with Tuan Tuan, gave birth to her first and only cub, Yuan Zai, in July 2013. The names of the pair produce the Chinese phrase tuan yuan, which means reunion. They are among the most popular attractions at the zoo. This article was originally produced and published by China Daily . • Read more about Chinese technology at China Watch
